result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy L Hopkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected -
does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Defendant Stacy L Hopkins in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties have received and reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts corrections on the record. Defense notes, as does the Court, that the deft denies involvement in the deft's version of the PSI. The Court conducts colloquy with the defendant and the defendant indicates she takes responsibility for the crimes.

BTC:  15CF1703 - sent w/held - 2 yrs prob.
          15CF1702 - 30 days RCJ/CFTS, costs, DNA costs

Conditions:
obey all rules and reg
30 hrs CSW, may be completed in the 2nd year of probation
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs -UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
must also have psych screening and cognitive intervention as well as vocational training
deft to be evaluated for battered woman's syndrome

FAW/vote

from ZCI - Incident Report
from ZCI - Incident Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  No contact with the victims, L.M.W. or L.H. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 6/14/16:  NO MIND ALTERING CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ATTEND 7 SELF HELP GROUPS PER WEEK, NA, AA OR A SECULAR MEETING.  VERIFIED BY SIGNED ATTENDANCE SHEETS AND TURN IN SHEETS TO ZCI.  ZCI TO TEST DEFENDANT WEEKLY.
